title: Drawing, Altars, Elevation, ca. 1780–90
medium: Pen and brown ink, gray wash, black chalk, streak of brown chalk on white laid paper
markings: Stamps: Collector's mark in blue ink at lower left corner: MB (Mary Brandegee)
inscribed: Partially obliterated inscription in graphite at lower left: [....]/Bernini
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The mensa stands in the center of a sockle part, upon which a second sockle row stands. A small tabernacle stands in front of it, containing in its central part, a reliquary shrine. The retable has the shape of an arch, which is flanked by three embedded columns on either side supporting the entablature and the broken pediment. Figures sit upon the cornices. Two angels support an ovoid with the dove in front of the central part, upon the entablature of which two more sit. Cherubims are on top of the ovoid. A small angel sits under it.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Altars, Elevation, ca. 1780–90. Pen and brown ink, gray wash, black chalk, streak of brown chalk on white laid paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-497
